message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of Computational Linguistics (cs.CL) because it presents an algorithm for recognizing synonyms based on statistical data acquired by querying a Web search engine. It also uses Pointwise Mutual Information (PMI) and Information Retrieval (IR) to measure the similarity of pairs of words, which are common techniques in computational linguistics. 

It could also belong to the sub-category of Information Retrieval (cs.IR) because it uses IR techniques to measure the similarity of pairs of words. 

The sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG) is also likely because the algorithm presented in the paper is an unsupervised learning algorithm. 

The sub-category of Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) is also possible because the paper presents a new algorithm for recognizing synonyms, which is a task that falls under the umbrella of natural language processing and AI. 

Finally, the sub-category of Cybernetics (cs.CY) is also possible because the paper presents a new algorithm for recognizing synonyms, which is a task that involves the study of communication and control processes in biological and artificial systems.
